The directive comes as the drug is yet to receive approval from the regulatory authority. As several manufacturers have been found producing and distributing this drug combination. Classified as a 'New Drug,' it has not secured the necessary regulatory approval. The drug is offered at a price of around ‚Çπ2,000 per dose. *FDCs under scanner* The central drug regulator has asked companies manufacturing two commonly prescribed cough and cold medications and available in fixed dose combinations (FDCs), which have been on sale for more than 30 years, to carry out trials to review their safety and efficacy. FDC refers to combining two or more drugs in a fixed ratio to develop a single dosage form. One of the cough and cold medications suggested for a fresh trial to assess safety includes drugs containing Paracetamol (antipyretic), Phenylephrine Hydrochloride (nasal decongestant) and Caffeine Anhydrous (processed caffeine)FDCs are justified when they demonstrate clear benefits in terms of potentiating the therapeutic efficacy, reducing the incidence of adverse effects of drugs, better compliance by reducing the pill burden and decreasing development of resistance among others.( Courtesy TOI) #fdcs #safety #efficacy #cough #cold #antipyretic #nasaldecongestant #caffeine #fixeddosecombinations

combination antibiotics .....there are many brands available e.g. amoxycillin + cloxacillin etc. one can search on Google easily... similarly, there are many other FDCs marketed in this country which are not available in stringent regulated countries......... combining two old drugs are defined as "new drug" and accordingly regulatory approvals were given under erstwhile schedule - Y of Drug Rule ......by DCGI. there are certain FDC s approved directly by some State Drugs control as well. ........ When antibiotic waste is released into rivers and waterways it can fuel #AntimicrobialResistance. To limit the impact of antibiotic manufacturing on #AMR, #pharma companies need to set limits on the concentration of antibiotic residue that can be present in manufacturing wastewater. Our 2021 AMR Benchmark found that 12 out of 17 companies in the scope apply discharge limits for #antibiotic waste at their own manufacturing sites.
